required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Lung Ultrasound in The Diagnosis of Weaning -Induced Pulmonary Edema
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Lung Ultrasound in The Diagnosis of Weaning -Induced Pulmonary Edema

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the work is to
1. Assess the incidence of weaning induced pulmonary adema(WIPO).
2. Assess the risk factors of WIPO.
3. Evaluate the role of lung ultrasound in detecting WIPO during spontenous breathing trial(SBT).
4. Detect the threshold of B-line increase (Delta-B-lines) that provided the best diagnostic accuracy of WIPO.

primary_outcome.measure: the number of B-lines in lung ultrasound and its accuracy in diagnosis of weaning induced pulmonary oedema

clinical_study.condition: Detecting the Number of B-lines in Lung Ultrasound and Its Accuracy in Diagnosis of Weaning Induced Pulmonary Oedema

arm_group.description: patient who will develop weaning induced pulmonary adema
patient who will nor develop weaning induced pulmonary adema

intervention.description: patient with or without weaning induced pulmonary adema

study_pop.textblock: The study will include patients on mechanical ventilation who will be suitable for spontaneous breathing trial (SBT).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The study will include patients on mechanical ventilation who will be suitable for spontaneous breathing trial (SBT).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with poor lung ultrasound window, history of cardiomyopathy, significant valvular disease (aortic or mitral insufficiency of grade â‰¥ 2, mild or severe aortic and mitral stenosis) will be excluded from the study.
